meanings.definition: Enlist or recruit for military service.
meanings.sent1: The army needed to conscribe more soldiers for the upcoming battle.
meanings.sent2: They conscribe young men and women to serve their country in times of need.
meanings.sent3: The king tried to conscribe his pet dog into the army, but everyone just laughed.
meanings.sent4: The idea of conscribing citizens into the military felt like a violation of their freedom.
meanings.sent5: The general's call to conscribe all able-bodied individuals echoed through the town.

meanings.sent1: She carefully conscribed her name on the tree trunk with a sharp rock.
meanings.sent2: The artist conscribed intricate patterns onto the metal surface.
meanings.sent3: He decided to conscribe his favorite quote onto his coffee mug for daily inspiration.
meanings.sent4: The memories were conscribed in her heart, never to be forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization conscribed their history on stone tablets for future generations to read.
